explanation: toxdigitvalue: MHD_strx_to_uint32_ only calls toxdigitvalue. To determine whether MHD_strx_to_uint32_ violates the MISRA rule against (direct or indirect) self-calls we must inspect the implementation of toxdigitvalue to see if it (directly or via its own callees) calls back to MHD_strx_to_uint32_ or to any function that would create a cycle leading to MHD_strx_to_uint32_. If toxdigitvalue has additional callees, their definitions must be inspected as well (the transitive callee chain must be checked), but the immediate additional symbol required is toxdigitvalue.
